basics.name: Nathan Nahina
basics.label: Computer Support Assistant
basics.summary: A driven, compassionate, individual seeking entry-level internship/employment related to Software Development with an heightened interest of smartphone applications and bridging the gap between technology and the Hawaiian culture.

highlights: Maintain, update, and oversee technical maintenance
Provide guests with excellent customer service, tend to each individualy with any concerns
Maintain a safe and healthy environment for family fun and provide personal vacation itineraries

volunteer.summary: Doing my part to take care of that which feeds us (aina, land)
highlights: Worked together up Manoa Stream to develop plots for a Native Hawaiian garden (mala)
Built a dam and dug an irrigation ditch (auwai) that connects back into the stream
Planted numerous native and hanai (adopted) Hawaiian plants
Farmed with tools that we made ourselves
Committed to take care (malama) of that area for the rest of my time in this world

volunteer.summary: Help the children (keiki) enjoy their experience in the provided ocean clinic
highlights: Safety and Education about the ocean and environment

awards.title: Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society Membership
awards.awarder: Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society (Alpha Lambda Gamma Chapter)
awards.summary: To be eligible for membership a student must have completed at least 12 hours of associate degree course work with a cumulative 3.5 GPA.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students who complete semesters of 12 or more credits with a GPA of 3.5 of higher.

awards.title: Na Ho'okama a Pau'ahi Scholarship
awards.summary: This scholarship is a gift from Bernice Pauahi, who knew that financial help for the Hawaiian people to pursue college education would be very important for the culture to move forward. This is the most sought after scholarship in terms of Native Hawaiian scholarships. Requirements for this scholarship include 50 hours of community service in which benefits the Hawaiian community, meetings with your post-high counselor, and other various assignments.

awards.title: OHA Native Hawaiian Science & Engineering Mentorship Program Scholarship
awards.summary: This scholarship is administered through the University of Hawai'i for the top Native Hawaiian students pursuing degrees in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM)

awards.title: Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: A maximum of 80 scholarships were awarded by the Office of Admissions to high-achieving Hawaiʻi high school graduates. Requirements include a 3.5 cumulative high school grade point average as calculated by the UH Mānoa Office of Admissions. Evidence of superior academic achievement or creative endeavor
